meanings.definition: To assimilate or cause to assimilate a different culture.
meanings.sent1: Children acculturate to new customs quickly.
meanings.sent2: She acculturated to the traditions of her new home.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to acculturate to the flamingo way of life.
meanings.sent4: The seedling acculturated to the rich soil, thriving in its new environment.
meanings.sent5: The exchange student had to acculturate to the local language to communicate effectively.

meanings.definition: To adapt or adjust to a new culture.
meanings.sent1: It takes time to acculturate to a different way of life.
meanings.sent2: He acculturated well to the customs of the foreign country.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to acculturate to human behavior, causing some funny mishaps.
meanings.sent4: Her mind began to acculturate to the vibrant city atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The plant had to acculturate to the arid climate, developing unique survival strategies.
